intro: Psychotria whistleri, commonly known as the Whistler's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in many parts of its range.
